tidbits.title: Kingdom of Dahomey
tidbits.description: Benin was once home to the powerful Kingdom of Dahomey, known for its skilled warriors and the historic city of Abomey, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

tidbits.title: Voodoo Tradition
tidbits.description: Benin is considered the birthplace of Voodoo (Vodun), a significant aspect of its culture, spirituality, and rituals, celebrated in various ceremonies.

tidbits.title: Artistic Heritage
tidbits.description: Benin is renowned for its artistic traditions, including intricately carved wooden masks and sculptures, reflecting its rich cultural heritage.
